reasoning: Lung neuroendocrine carcinomas represent 20-25% of lung malignancies. SEER database studies show incidence increased from 0.3 per 100k (1973) to 1.35 per 100k (2004). Large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma specifically ~0.3 per 100k, carcinoid tumors ~0.7-1.0 per 100k. Using overall pulmonary NEN incidence of ~1.35 per 100k.
source: Incidence and Survival Outcomes in Patients with Lung Neuroendocrine Neoplasms in the United States - PMC8067543; SEER surveillance data 1973-2004
